text:
Hi, 

I am using xsl fo to generate PDF. In order to make internal links work in PDF, 
I have applied fo:basic-link under fo:inline element. 

The issue that i am facing is that when the text on which there is a link is 
too long and the text comes in more than one line, the link is only on starting 
few characters and not on the rest of the text. But if the text comes in a 
single line then the link appears on  the entire text. So the issue really is 
when the text is long and comes in more than one line the link is not properly 
rendered. 

Kindly help me on this as it is an urgent requirement. 

Thanks, 
Shriram
creator: gupta.vinod@ge.com

text: Please state which version of FOP you are using: 0.20.5 or 0.92beta.
creator: bowditch_chris@hotmail.com
bowditch_chris@hotmail.com
text:
FOP 0.20.x is no longer supported. Please retest your FO on 0.92beta. Please 
free to re-open the bug if your FO fails with 0.92beta.

creator: manuel@apache.org
text:
Tested this with a long multi-line internal and external link against fop trunk
and 0.92beta and it works fine.

If it doesn't work for you against these releases please reopen and attach a
sample fo file which shows the problem.

creator: adelmelle@apache.org
text:
Sorry, but the PDF by itself is not enough. Please post the FO, so we can run it through FOP ourselves to 
debug this.

BTW: the producer field in the document properties seems to indicate this PDF wasn't produced with FOP 
at all...

creator: adelmelle@apache.org
text:
(In reply to comment #5)
> BTW: the producer field in the document properties seems to indicate this PDF wasn't produced with FOP 
> at all...

Could it be that you're actually rendering to PostScript and then send the PS through Acrobat Distiller? If 
so, the problem might be in the PS Renderer (long shot...)

creator: manuel@apache.org
text:
If I run the FO file through fop (trunk and 0.92) I get an exception related to
page sequences and regions.

Can you attach a working (and smaller if possible) version of the FO file please.

(In reply to comment #8)
> If I run the FO file through fop (trunk and 0.92) I get an exception related to
> page sequences and regions.

Confirmed. Why would anyone file a bug against v0.92 when obviously not using that version at all?

Would like to repeat the following question to the OP: 
Are you *absolutely certain* that FOP is even used to produce the erroneous PDF? Judging from the 
metadata, the document was at least post-processed by Adobe Distiller.

If you can't provide the right info, we can't help you. Sorry, but that's just the way it works...
